main event: A newspaper photographer reported seeing a silver disc hovering over a wooded area in Leibnitz, Austria on March 9, 1950.
interesting points: The object hovered at about 45 degrees, accelerated to high speed and disappeared in about 10 seconds., The sighting lasted for 10 minutes and was reported by a newspaper photographer., A previous report mentioned a white-glowing object photographed by a local photographer., The object caused a patch of grass to turn brown and wilt due to heat, suggesting possible radiation effects., The object was described as disc-shaped and metallic, with a diameter of about 6-8 meters.
